<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 134, 378, 158]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 183, 193, 213]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 233, 175, 263]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 183, 905, 271]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 288, 178, 304]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 264, 328]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 367, 395, 383]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 395, 359, 411]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 222, 446]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 447, 808, 586]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 615, 213, 630]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 631, 730, 663]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 92, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 787, 101]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows the speed–time graph for a car travelling along a flat straight road.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[89, 112, 880, 465]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 479, 529, 498]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 540, 920, 559]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 603, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 634, 146, 653]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 634, 828, 653]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 790, 920, 810]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 82, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
A student wants to find the volume of a piece of metal. The student can use any of the items of equipment shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 380, 920, 415]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 612, 146, 631]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 612, 903, 632]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[549, 831, 917, 850]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 612, 836, 631]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 784, 638, 803]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[485, 907, 920, 925]]<|/det|>

speed = ............................................... $cm/s$ <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 269, 148, 287]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 269, 836, 287]]<|/det|> The student puts a block into the ripple tank, as shown in Fig. 6.1. The block sinks. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 284, 650, 303]]<|/det|> The waves travel towards the block and then over the block. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 307, 771, 457]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 470, 532, 489]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 502, 871, 520]]<|/det|> State and explain what happens to the waves as they travel over the edge of the block. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 628, 144, 645]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 798, 645]]<|/det|> The chart in Fig. 6.2 shows the main regions of the electromagnetic spectrum. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 907, 700]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 848, 101]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 81, 504, 101]]<|/det|>
U-235 and U-238 are isotopes of uranium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 112, 660, 133]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 140, 621, 175]]<|/det|>

<mark>[1]

Cambridge Assessment International Education is part of Cambridge Assessment. Cambridge Assessment is the brand name of the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES), which is a department of the University of Cambridge.
